Class ShareteaPOS

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.ShareteaPOS
public class ShareteaPOS extends Object
Main application class for the Sharetea POS System.

This class serves as the entry point for the Sharetea Point of Sale application. It handles application initialization, database connection validation, and launches the user interface. The application follows a standard Java Swing architecture with proper error handling and logging.

Key responsibilities:

  • Application startup and initialization
  • Database connection validation
  • Logging configuration and setup
  • User interface launch and error handling
  • Graceful application shutdown on errors

The application requires a valid database connection to function properly. If the database connection fails, the application will display an error message and terminate to prevent further issues.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • LoginFrame

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main entry point for the Sharetea POS application.

      This method initializes the application by setting up logging, testing the database connection, and launching the login interface. If any critical initialization step fails, the application will display an error message and terminate gracefully.

      The initialization process includes:

      1. Configuring logging format and levels
      2. Testing database connectivity
      3. Launching the login frame on the Event Dispatch Thread
      4. Handling any startup errors with user-friendly messages
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments (not currently used)
